intro: Cheiridopsis intrusa, commonly known as the intruding ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are small, green, and often covered with a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, yellow or orange flowers during the summer months, adding a delicate touch to its arid habitat.
